TopicTitle: Lost all my programs on my calculator, how can I recover them?

Articles.Content:
Hi!

I made a simple script in my tI84 plus calculator.

That program, was just choosing a random number; your goal was to find that number, at eachh attempts you were told if you number was too high or too low.

Jot long ago, I tried to put a imaginary number instead of a real one.

Then, I was told that the RAM was cleared and I lost all my scripts ;_;

Is there any way to recover my other scripts?

Even if I can recover ALL if them, can I recover a few of them, or even just the majority of the code???

Thank you in advance!
Typically, calculators only have battery powered RAM, not flash. If it says it's gone, then it's probably gone.

thank you the answer, I guess I will have to redo them.

On the bright side, I taped the codes on my computer, two years ago, so some of them aren't exactly lost(but I still have to rewrite them).

Also, I didn't forget how I did the programs so, even if I will have to think a little, redoing them won't be the most difficult task.

Finally, it will give me an opportunity to optimise the codes: seriously, some of them were a complete mess(sometime, I added a big feature after the code was done, and the original code wasn't meant to support the new feature).
